solution.text:
Since triangle BCD is right angled triangle, thus using Pythagoras we have:
\(CD^2 = BC^2 + BD^2\)
\(BD^2 = CD^2 - BC^2 = d^2 - c^2 = _{{5*j}}_^2 - _{{3*j}}_^2 = _{{4*j}}_^2 \)
Thus, BD = _{{4*j}}_
Now we know that :
i.e, Area of DBC = \({1\over 2}\times base\times height\)
i.e, Area of DBC = \({1\over 2}\times _{{3*j}}_\times _{{4*j}}_\)
i.e, Area of DBC = \(_{{6*j*j}}_\)

content.text:
Given that a = _{i}_, b = _{{i-4*j}}_, c = _{{3*j}}_ and d = _{{5*j}}_
If \(\angle\) DBC = \(90^\circ\), Find the area of \(\triangle\)DBC.
